isis.stitle: 7.3 Liter Diesel Engine Service (1991) - MANIFOLDS - INTAKE MANIFOLD - INSTALLATION

step1.para:
Apply a 1/4 inch bead of RTV (included with Valley Pan Gasket package) at the front of the crankcase and overlap 1/2 inch onto each cylinder head ( Figure 2.12
).

Apply two 1/4 inch beads of RTV at the rear of the crankcase and overlap 1/2 inch onto each cylinder head ( Figure 2.12
).

important.para: AFTER APPLICATION OF R.T.V. SEALANT, COMPLETE ASSEMBLY OF THE VALLEY PAN, STRAPS AND INTAKE MANIFOLD WITHIN 15 MINUTES.

figure.caption: Figure 2.12 R.T.V. Sealant Application for Valley Pan Installation

note.para: 1989 Model Year and beyond have cup plugs in the coolant passages and DO NOT require Loctite 515 Gasket Eliminator.

important.para: FOLLOW THE DIRECTIONS ON THE LOCTITE 515 CONTAINER FOR PROPER APPLICATION PROCEDURES.

figure.caption: Figure 2.13 Apply Loctite 515 to Valley Pan Gasket Sealing Area Around Water Ports [1988 Model Year and Earlier]

step1.para:
Place the new valley pan gasket onto the crankcase. Install the valley pan strap and tighten the four bolts and washers to the standard torque ( Figure 2.14
).

important.para: DO NOT WIPE OFF EXCESS R.T.V. SEALANT FROM THE VALLEY PAN AFTER INSTALLATION. ALLOW THE R.T.V. TO OOZE AT THE MATING SURFACE. DO NOT ATTEMPT TO EVEN OUT THE RTV.

step1.para:
Apply an additional 1/4 inch bead of RTV to the valley pan cutouts at the rear of the pan. Refer to Figure 2.15
.

Install the valley pan drain plug and tighten to the specified torque. Refer to "Special Torques" in this section or the Appendix. Refer to Figure 2.15
.

Install intake manifold. Install the eighteen intake manifold mounting bolts and three lifting eyes to their original positions. Refer to Figure 2.8
for lifting eye location.
Tighten mounting bolts as specified under "Special Torques" in this section.
Refer to the appropriate manual section for installation procedures for these components.
